# Simple Tutorial

This is a simple tutorial showing how to use cmake_generator to create a C++ project.

## Step 1: Create a simple YAML configuration

Create a file called `simple.yaml`:

```yaml
project:
  name: HelloWorld
  version: 1.0.0
  cmake_minimum: 3.10

compiler:
  cpp_standard: 11

targets:
  - name: hello
    type: executable
    sources:
      - main.cpp
```

## Step 2: Generate CMakeLists.txt

Run:
```bash
cmake-gen simple.yaml
```

This creates a `CMakeLists.txt` file:

```cmake
# Generated by cmake_generator

cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.10)

project(HelloWorld
    VERSION 1.0.0
    LANGUAGES CXX
)

set(CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD 11)
set(CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD_REQUIRED ON)
set(CMAKE_CXX_EXTENSIONS OFF)

# Target: hello
add_executable(hello main.cpp)
```

## Step 3: Create your source file

Create `main.cpp`:

```cpp
#include <iostream>

int main() {
    std::cout << "Hello, World!" << std::endl;
    return 0;
}
```

## Step 4: Build your project

```bash
mkdir build
cd build
cmake ..
make
./hello
```

That's it! You've created a C++ project without manually writing CMakeLists.txt.
